comments.text:
We have detected an awsy regression from push:

https://hg.mozilla.org/integration/autoland/pushloghtml?changeset=dc605bd20b0b3e2cbab07f028aa4fb96c7186003

As author of one of the patches included in that push, we need your help to address this regression.

Regressions:

  10%  Images macosx1014-64-shippable opt         5,621,682.71 -> 6,200,583.06
  10%  Images macosx1014-64-shippable opt         5,621,682.71 -> 6,184,063.94
   8%  Images windows10-64-shippable opt          6,529,609.67 -> 7,021,537.81
   5%  Images macosx1014-64-shippable opt tp6     8,822,704.23 -> 9,275,087.39


You can find links to graphs and comparison views for each of the above tests at: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/perf.html#/alerts?id=25664

On the page above you can see an alert for each affected platform as well as a link to a graph showing the history of scores for this test. There is also a link to a treeherder page showing the jobs in a pushlog format.

To learn more about the regressing test(s), please see: https://wiki.mozilla.org/AWSY/Tests
comments.creator: marian.raiciof@softvision.ro
comments.author: marian.raiciof@softvision.ro

comments.text: So while this patch works as intended as far as I can tell, it apparently didn't fix the talos regression. I'll investigate further in bug 1633635.
comments.raw_text: So while this patch works as intended as far as I can tell, it apparently didn't fix the talos regression. I'll investigate further in bug 1633635.
